 25 -class Magnetometer(Sensor): 

 26      """ 
 27      Base class for magnetometers. 
 28      """ 
 29   

 30 -    def trueValues(self, t): 

 31          b = self.platform.simulation.environment.magneticField( 
 32                  self.trajectory.position(t), t) 
 33          return self.trajectory.rotation(t).rotateFrame(b)

 53 -class HMC105x(NoisyTransformedSensor, Magnetometer): 

 54      """ 
 55      Model of the Honeywell HMC105x magnetometer as used in the Orient-3 IMU. 
 56   
 57      B{N.B. This model includes an INA321 instrument amplifier circuit.} 
 58   
 59      The HMC105x has a sensitivity of 1mV/V/Gauss +- 20%. IMUSim uses Teslas for 
 60      magnetic field measurements, where 1 Tesla = 10,000 Gauss. 
 61   
 62      The Orient-3 design uses an INA321 precision instrument amplifier with 
 63      a gain of 380+-1% to amplify the magnetometer signal prior to sampling. 
 64      """ 
 65   
 66      VOLTS_PER_VOLT_PER_GAUSS = 1E-3 
 67      GAUSS_PER_TESLA = 10000 
 68      VDD = 3.3 
 69      SENSITIVITY = VOLTS_PER_VOLT_PER_GAUSS * GAUSS_PER_TESLA * VDD 
 70      MAX_SENSITIVITY_ERROR = 0.2 # 20% 
 71      INA321_NOMINAL_GAIN = 380 
 72      BRIDGE_OFFSET = 0.5E-3 * VDD 
 73      INA321_INPUT_OFFSET = 200E-6 
 74      CROSS_AXIS = 0.05 
 75   
 76      @prepend_method_doc(Magnetometer) 

 77 -    def __init__(self, platform, noiseStdDev, rng=None, **kwargs): 

 78          """ 
 79          @param noiseStdDev: Standard deviation of measured output voltage 
 80              noise in the system in which the magnetometer is integrated. 
 81          @param rng: L{np.random.RandomState} from which to draw imperfections. 
 82          """ 
 83   
 84          if rng is None: 
 85              rng = np.random.RandomState() 
 86   
 87          sensitivity = self.SENSITIVITY 
 88          sensitivity *= self.INA321_NOMINAL_GAIN 
 89          sensitivity *= rng.normal(size=3, loc=1, 
 90                  scale=self.MAX_SENSITIVITY_ERROR/3) 
 91   
 92          sensitivity = np.diag(sensitivity) 
 93          cross_axis = np.eye(3) 
 94          for s in ((i,j) for i,j in np.ndindex(3, 3) if i<>j): 
 95              cross_axis[s] = rng.normal(loc=0, scale=self.CROSS_AXIS/3) 
 96          transform = np.dot(sensitivity,cross_axis) 
 97   
 98          offset = self.VDD / 2 
 99          offset += rng.normal(size=(3, 1), loc=0, 
100                  scale=self.INA321_INPUT_OFFSET * self.INA321_NOMINAL_GAIN/3) 
101          offset += rng.normal(size=(3, 1), loc=0, 
102                  scale=self.BRIDGE_OFFSET * self.INA321_NOMINAL_GAIN/3) 
103   
104          NoisyTransformedSensor.__init__(self, platform, noiseStdDev, 
105                  transform, offset, **kwargs)
